article.headline: Long Beach St. 99, UC Riverside 65
article.story: LONG BEACH, Calif. (AP) -- Kevin Houston scored a season-high 17 points and Long Beach State won for the 11th time in 12 games as the 49ers beat UC Riverside 99-65 Saturday. Long Beach State (13-5, 4-1 Big West Conference) beat the Highlanders (3-17, 0-7) for the fourth straight time and improved to 8-0 at home this season. The win combined with UC Santa Barbara's loss to Cal Poly Saturday left Long Beach State alone in first place in the Big West. UC Riverside lost its 15th straight, one shy of a school record set more than 50 years ago. Long Beach State went on a 19-6 run midway through the first-half to break the game open and take a 29-14 lead. Dominique Ricks' lay-up at the buzzer increased the 49ers' lead to 54-33 at halftime. UC Riverside never got closer than 19 in the second-half. Five other 49ers scored in double figures. Ricks scored 15 points, Aaron Nixon 14, Kejuan Johnson 12, Mark Dawson 11 and Sterling Byrd 10. Johnson also had nine assists and four steals. Long Beach State made 39 of 69 shots (56.5 percent), out-rebounded the Highlanders 38-28 and forced 20 UC Riverside turnovers. Chris Johnson scored 16 points and Larry Cunningham added 13 points for the Highlanders.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
